title: Mathematics Learning Module Design Using CTL Approach Based on the ADDIE Model

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Module designed for smartphone-centric access in limited-technology environments, featuring real-case-based learning considering workplace applicability for professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can design math learning modules by applying the five stages of the ADDIE model (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation).
Learners improve 4C competencies (critical thinking, creativity, collaboration, communication) in problem-solving processes using the CTL (Communicative Task-Based Learning) approach.
Through project-based assessments, learners develop and present math modules applicable to real-world work environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
